channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: WV gov gives update on wounded guardsman, talks future of DC mission as general says troops are grieving
item.description: West Virginia National Guard Staff Sgt. Andrew Wolfe shows signs of improvement after Washington shooting that killed fellow guardsman Sarah Beckstrom...

item.title: EV sales take a dive without taxpayer subsidies
item.description: Americans were already feeling uneasy about purchasing an electric vehicle. Then the generous tax subsidies ended.

item.title: Results of Trump's MRI 'perfectly normal,' White House physician says

item.title: Claims Afghans Were ‘Vetted’ Contradict Federal Investigations And Common Sense
item.description: The process by which the Biden administration ushered Afghans into the United States barely resembles 'vetting' at all.

item.title: New Docs Reveal Jack Smith Intentionally Violated Congressional Republicans’ Constitutional Rights
item.description: Smith never should have approved the subpoenas since they violated the congressional Republicans’ clearly established rights.

item.title: Wisconsin’s Lib-Led Supreme Court Stacks The Congressional Map Deck
item.description: The latest leftist gerrymander stunt should serve as a reminder to Republicans that failure to rewrite representation lines is not an option.

item.title: GOP senator moves to end dual citizenship, says Americans must choose
item.description: The Ohio Republican's Exclusive Citizenship Act of 2025 would end dual-citizenship laws and require Americans to renounce foreign citizenships.

item.title: Venezuela White House meeting kicks off Trump’s high-stakes week as Cabinet huddle looms
item.description: The White House will hold a meeting on Venezuela as President Donald Trump confirmed speaking with President Nicolás Maduro amid escalating tensions.

item.title: Appeals Court: Alina Habba May Not Serve as De Facto U.S. Attorney
item.description: Trump and Bondi’s finagling with the appointment process has gotten them nowhere.

item.title: Make the Case for Regime-Change War in Venezuela
item.description: Trump should present to the voters and Congress his case for war without euphemism or evasion.

item.title: 10 Tips To Keep Smartphones From Making Your Kids Tired, Fat, And Miserable
item.description: A new study serves as a sobering warning to parents to avoid giving smartphones to their kids until absolutely necessary.

item.title: No, Trump Is Not to Blame for the National Guard Shooting
item.description: The reaction in the media to this attack is as predictable as it is revolting.

item.title: ‘Big Short’ investor Michael Burry revives his short bet against Tesla, calling the stock ‘ridiculously overvalued’
item.description: Burry first shorted Tesla in 2021 but exited the trade months later.

item.title: Here’s A List Of Unique, Made-In-America Gifts From Each State
item.description: The American Dream – that if you work hard, anyone can get ahead— is fulfilled by the risk takers who start businesses.

item.title: Who is Kevin Hassett? The rumored Fed pick says inflation is ‘way down,’ sees ‘political bias’ in jobs data, and suggested firing Powell over a renovation
item.description: “If you’d asked me a year ago, I would have said I think Kevin would be a good pick. I wouldn’t say that today. Kevin has been incredibly dishonest.”

item.title: How a park bench meeting led to Aflac’s $200 million mascot idea
item.description: “Quack, quack, Aflac became the idea,” CEO Dan Amos told Fortune. The adoption of the avian mascot has coincided with a 621% run-up in share price.
